jd: From: Dilip, Ideatetechnologies dilip.c@ideatetechnologies.com Reply to: dilip.c@ideatetechnologies.com Hi All,I hope you are doing well today!Please find the JD below and let me know your interest with best resumes. Job Title: Sr Business AnalystJob Location: Phoenix, AZDuration: 6+Months contractType: C2C,W2 onlyVisa: USC/GC PreferredJob Role: Hybrid Job Description:Job Summary: We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Sr Business Analyst to join our team. The ideal candidate will have extensive knowledge of the shipping domain, international trade, booking, billing, and tariff maintenance. This role involves leading complex projects, analyzing business processes, and providing strategic insights to drive efficiency and growth.Key Responsibilities:Lead Business Analysis Efforts: Oversee and guide the business analysis activities for projects related to shipping, international trade, booking, billing, and tariff maintenance.Stakeholder Management: Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to gather requirements, define project scope, and ensure alignment with business objectives.Process Improvement: Identify opportunities for process optimization and implement solutions to enhance operational efficiency and accuracy.Data Analysis: Analyze large datasets to extract meaningful insights and support decision-making processes.Documentation: Create detailed business requirement documents, process flows, and functional specifications.Compliance and Regulations: Ensure all business processes comply with relevant international trade regulations and shipping industry standards.Training and Mentorship: Provide guidance and mentorship to junior analysts and team members.Qualifications:Education: Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, International Trade, Logistics, or a related field.Experience: Minimum of 8-10 years of experience in business analysis within the shipping domain, focusing on international trade, booking, billing, and tariff maintenance.Skills:Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.Proficiency in data analysis tools and software.Knowledge of international trade regulations and shipping industry standards.Ability to work independently and as part of a team.Preferred Qualifications:Certification in Business Analysis (CBAP or equivalent).Experience in building Ocean Transportation software.Familiarity with Agile methodologies.
